cleaned.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

raw.title: [BIP-551] Claim and Relock Balancer DAO’s AURA / vlAURA
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/819

## Summary

The Balancer DAO has locked its vested AURA into vlAURA with [[BIP-481]](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-481-claim-and-lock-balancer-dao-aura-allocation-into-vlaura/5319). The first lock of 1.42m AURA will expire and can be relocked after March 7th and before the unlolck date of March 14th, 2024:

 
![bip-551.png](ipfs://bafkreigqscbntq3fhxjxnaicwwfro3tn7zzntkhpp4ecec25bd7c5z3bfi)
    

The DAO wishes to relock its current position and bundle it with an additional vest so the next unlock is bundled into one in 16 weeks from the relock date.

## Motivation

The Balancer DAO wishes to relock its vlAURA position to continue to vote for Balancer gauges with its position. To do so the DAO needs to relock its expired position timely after March 7th and before March 14th 2024

At the time of writing, the DAO is entitled again to roughly ~280k AURA tokens (can be verified by calling `available` with `_recipient` as `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` https://etherscan.io/address/0xfd72170339ac6d7bdda09d1eaca346b21a30d422 ). Another ~297k AURA remains unvested and will be claimed at a later date.

We are proposing to initiate another lock with the available ~280k AURA to be used to vote on AURA governance. The specifics of the Balancer DAOs voting allocations can be found [here](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-508-utilize-locked-aura-to-support-ecosystem-growth/5419).

By re-locking the initial position and vesting additional AURA between March 7th and March 14th which would fall into the same locking epoch, it is guaranteed that the entirety of the locks will be up for re-lock in 16 weeks, reducing load on the multi-sig, streamlining the management of this position.

## Specification

The Balancer DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the vlAURA contract at `0x3fa73f1e5d8a792c80f426fc8f84fbf7ce9bbcac` and call `processExpiredLocks` with argument `true` - The execution needs to be timed AFTER March 7th and BEFORE March 14th

Additionally, the DAO multisig on mainnet `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will call the `claim` function on the AuraVestedEscrow at `0xfd72170339ac6d7bdda09d1eaca346b21a30d422` with the parameter `_lock` set to `true`. This execution, as well as the above, needs to be timed AFTER March 7th and BEFORE March 14th

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-638] Claim and Relock Balancer DAO’s Additional AURA/vlAURA
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1099

## Summary

The Balancer DAO has locked its vested AURA into vlAURA with [[BIP-481]](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-481-claim-and-lock-balancer-dao-aura-allocation-into-vlaura/5319). The second lock of 1.74m AURA will expire and can be relocked after June 27th and before the unlock date of July 4th, 2024:

 
![vlAura.png](ipfs://bafkreihdvdnzfszhe7tmwnhhha7qmgnerpfmh52h7fxdeyihj3n5ox2hjm)
    

The DAO wishes to relock its current position and bundle it with an additional vest so the next unlock is bundled into one in 16 weeks from the relock date as done previously in [[BIP-551]](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-551-claim-and-relock-balancer-daos-aura-vlaura/5588).

## Motivation

The Balancer DAO wishes to relock its vlAURA position to continue to vote for Balancer gauges with its position. To do so the DAO needs to relock its expired position timely after June 27th and before July 4th 2024

At the time of writing, the DAO is entitled again to roughly ~255k AURA tokens (can be verified by calling `available` with `_recipient` as `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` https://etherscan.io/address/0xfd72170339ac6d7bdda09d1eaca346b21a30d422 ). Another ~5-10k AURA remains unvested and will be claimed at a later date.

We are proposing to initiate another lock with the available ~255k AURA to be used to vote on AURA governance. The specifics of the Balancer DAOs voting allocations can be found [here](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-508-utilize-locked-aura-to-support-ecosystem-growth/5419).

By re-locking the initial position and vesting additional AURA between June 27th and July 4th which would fall into the same locking epoch, it is guaranteed that the entirety of the locks will be up for re-lock in 16 weeks, reducing load on the multi-sig, streamlining the management of this position.

## Specification

The Balancer DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the vlAURA contract at `0x3fa73f1e5d8a792c80f426fc8f84fbf7ce9bbcac` and call `processExpiredLocks` with argument `true` - The execution needs to be timed AFTER June 27th and BEFORE July 4th

Additionally, the DAO multisig on mainnet `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will call the `claim` function on the AuraVestedEscrow at `0xfd72170339ac6d7bdda09d1eaca346b21a30d422` with the parameter `_lock` set to `true`. This execution, as well as the above, needs to be timed AFTER June 27th and BEFORE July 4th

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-715] Enable Automatic Aura Relocking
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
Payload with PR:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1420

# Background

The DAO claimed its AURA allocation and locked it in [BIP-481](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-481-claim-and-lock-balancer-dao-aura-allocation-into-vlaura/5319), and later more claiming/locking occurred via [BIP-551](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-551-claim-and-relock-balancer-daos-aura-vlaura/5588) and [BIP-638](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-638-claim-and-relock-balancer-daos-additional-aura-vlaura/5811). As a result the DAO multisig now has 2m vlAURA, which will become available to be relocked `2024-10-17 00:00UTC` and will otherwise unlock `2024-10-24 00:00UTC`.

The voting power is actively being used strategically every epoch, and the DAO would like to keep doing so. Therefore, in order to (1) prevent having to create a new BIP for every relock, and to (2) reduce the risk of the DAO multisig not being able to execute this relocking every cycle within the right time window, we developed a Safe module that does this automatically: [`AuraLockerModule.sol`](https://github.com/onchainification/aura_locker_v2/blob/main/src/AuraLockerModule.sol).
 
![99c62e3a1b141e4650ec239242ef693d3ad5acce.png](ipfs://bafkreiadk3sqmjsnpbwggqpx57ljurxvt5t5ze5jpuzjytwknlhyrgikiq)
    
# Summary

The proposal here is to enable this module on the DAO multisig, and to thus let the module, on behalf of the DAO multisig, relock all vlAURA automatically every cycle as soon as that becomes possible. If this were to for some reason fail, the DAO multisig will have the mandate to relock manually every cycle. The module can be disabled at any time to prevent relocking from occurring, if the DAO were to have other plans with its AURA allocation.

# Risks

A variant of the same contract by the same author has been [running in production](https://etherscan.io/address/0xC485aFD2f3252cCB69d1c94392701d51013D42eB) successfully for a different DAO. [This Dune query](https://dune.com/queries/4143358) shows all of its successful automatic relocking events (note how almost all of them occur at the first block at midnight UTC). Besides Maxi’s internal reviews, a Balancer Labs contributor (@mkflow27) did a review of the contract. If the module fails to perform its task, the DAO multisig still has 7 days to relock via a manual call (`0x3Fa73f1E5d8A792C80F426fc8F84FBF7Ce9bBCAC.processExpiredUnlocks(true)`).

# Payload

DAO multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` on Ethereum will call `enableModule(0xfD20C63554A9916816dC5e5Df596A0333185F263)` on itself.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-419] Kill Duplicate BRZ/jBRL Gauge [Polygon]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/495

#### Summary
BRZ/jBRL has recently moved to a new pool and gauge. The current pool utilized can be seen [here](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0x42942cdec85078cf0e28e9cb5acd40cb53997ed6000000000000000000000bea). The duplicate pool, which is not utilized can be seen [here](https://0xe19ed40a47f9b0cea4ca6d372df66107758913ec000000000000000000000b41). There is no need to have a gauge for both pools active on the gauge controller, therefore I am proposing to kill the gauge which serves no purpose.

Pool address: [0xe19ed40A47F9B0CEA4ca6D372dF66107758913Ec](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0xe19ed40a47f9b0cea4ca6d372df66107758913ec000000000000000000000b41)
Gauge address: [0x455f20c54b5712a84454468c7831f7c431aeeb1c](https://etherscan.io/address/0x455f20c54b5712a84454468c7831f7c431aeEB1C#readContract)

#### Specification:

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call performAction using `0xab8f0945` for the `data(bytes)` argument and the gauge address `0x455f20c54b5712a84454468c7831f7c431aeeb1c` will be used for the `target(address)` argument.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-316] Replace veBAL Gauge
raw.author: 0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3
raw.body:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/233

### Motivation

The current veBAL gauge directs emissions to a recipient, then the emissions must be withdrawn and deposited to the fee distributor. This is a permissioned action that can be deprecated by utilizing the latest `singleRecipientGauge` factory which has the capability to deposit tokens directly into the fee distributor. Once this new gauge is added to the checkpointer the process of distributing BAL emissions to veBAL will be fully automated.

### Specification

1.
The DAO Multisig `eth:0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the AuthorizerAdapterEntryPoint `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` with the following arguments:

target: `0xE867AD0a48e8f815DC0cda2CDb275e0F163A480b` which corresponds to the veBAL gauge
data: `0xab8f0945` which corresponds to the function for kill()

2. 
The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following argument:

gauge: `0xb78543e00712C3ABBA10D0852f6E38FDE2AaBA4d` which corresponds to the new 10% capped gauge for veBAL

gaugeType: `EthereumSingleRecipientGauge`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal requests manual relock of the Balancer DAO's vested AURA tokens into vlAURA before the expiration window, ensuring continuity of locked positions and protocol stability.
key_arguments_for: Maintains vested AURA locked in vlAURA, preserving voting power and protocol incentives.
Strong early and stable voting support with unanimous vote indication for 'Yes'.
Similar past proposals with 'Yes' votes led to positive market responses and protocol benefits.
Independent security audit pending before enabling new automatic relock module, ensuring caution.
key_arguments_against: Market impact shows some negative price and TVL reaction, indicating caution among investors.
Forum discussion sentiment is neutral, lacking strong community endorsement or opposition.

evidence.quote: Forum comments are neutral; first comment explains the manual relock and audit delay.
Timeline shows unanimous lead for 'Yes, let's do it' with high stability and early voting.
Similar proposals had successful votes with positive market impacts.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• The timeline metrics show unanimous and stable early support for the 'Yes' option, indicating strong voter consensus.
• The proposal is a routine manual relock of vested tokens, essential for maintaining protocol incentives and governance power.
• Adjacent similar proposals were successful with positive market responses, supporting the decision to approve this proposal.
• Forum sentiment is neutral but does not oppose the proposal, thus the recommendation aligns with both voting data and community sentiment.
• Despite slight negative market price and TVL impact indications, the long-term protocol benefit favors approving the relock.
• This recommendation mirrors the aggregated forum opinion and voting trends, endorsing a change stance.
